title: SB 1.19.29-31 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 30-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Pariksit was very glad to receive a great devotee of the Lord, and he bowed down before Shukadeva Goswami with all the limbs of his body.
segments.summary: This segment focuses on the arrival of Shukadeva Goswami and the respectful reception he received, particularly Maharaj Pariksit's humble obeisances, and how Shukadeva Goswami reciprocated greetings based on individuals' positions.

segments.key_quote: Shukadeva Goswami was then surrounded by saintly sages and demigods, just as the moon is surrounded by stars, planets and other heavenly bodies.
segments.summary: This segment describes the glorious appearance of Shukadeva Goswami in the assembly, comparing it to the moon surrounded by stars, emphasizing his radiance amidst other great personalities.

segments.key_quote: The devotee of the Lord is more honored in the world than the Lord himself.
segments.summary: This segment explains that a devotee of the Lord is more honored than the Lord Himself, quoting Krishna's instruction to Uddhava that His devotees should be worshipped with greater respect than Him.

segments.key_quote: One should humbly approach a spiritual master to understand the transcendental signs.
segments.summary: This segment describes Shukadeva Goswami's readiness to answer questions and Maharaj Pariksit's humble approach to him, emphasizing the importance of approaching a spiritual master with humility and proper etiquette.
